text: as part of its ongoing commitment to
player health and safety the NFL teamed
up with Amazon web services AWS to
create the digital athlete program built
in the AWS cloud with artificial
intelligence Ai and machine learning the
program runs virtual representations of
NFL players through endless simulations
of in-game scenarios revealing new
insights into player injury
prevention this is leading to
advancements such as better risk
analysis for injury more specialized
player training and Recovery regimens
improvements to protective equipment and
new game rules through continual
iteration these AI models become more
accurate as time goes on just as a
quarterback does countless reps that
generate gradual improvements to their
technique an AI model can input
increasingly more video footage and data
and tweak its parameters to generate
better insights in both cases practice
and repetition are key to help prevent
head injuries the helmet impact
detection AI model is trained on
thousands of examples of helmets and
impacts identified by humans the system
which can reliably detect and measure
helmet contact is paired with another AI
model along with data from the NFL's
NextGen Stat system on
AWS the resulting insights are giving
teams a better understanding of head
injury risks and helping improve how the
game is taught and played AWS also
harness is AI to analyze how players
move on the field that's called the pose
estimation model the system uses
computer vision to analyze video footage
and identify various points on a
player's body which then are used to
construct a 3D skeletal representation
of a player this data is used to better
understand how certain poses or postures
may lead to injuries for players at
certain positions and during certain
types of plays it also informs how
players recover from injuries
together AWS and the NFL are using
modern Technologies to make a long-term
positive impact on America's favorite
sport by building a more exciting game
for fans and a better safer game for
[Music]
players
